intro: Navarretia dianthiflora, commonly known as the Sierra dianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, bell-shaped blossoms that bloom in late spring. Navarretia dianthiflora is often found in high elevation areas and is adapted to thrive in cooler, moist environments.
